Comment: Here I'm white playing the sicilian in a blitz game.
Here I'm white playing the sicilian in a blitz game.

Well, Nc3 could could be fine, but I have a huge preference on open lines and attack. A lot of players on gameknot do Bc4, but I don't think it's that great because there is too much counterplay after that.

?! There is a lot of good possibilities with the sicilian in the opening. Most of the time, people continue with Nc3 or Nb5 here but since it's rare that I come to that line, I wanted to try Bc4. Bc4 was not the best option here since e6 blocks the way to the king and sometime there is a lot of counterplay with Na5 or a6+b5. I think however that it can be useful later in the game.

?! It give too much of counterplay and tempo for white. Ne6 would have been a better option.

I didn't wanted to do Nc3 because after Bxc3 bxc3, my pawn structure would have looked bad. It's true that I would have gained some open lines and the bishop but I don't think it was an enough compensation. Bd2 could have been a nice possibility giving me some nice tempo. c3 give the possibility to continue with b4 and a4 later and to secure the center.
? Very bad idea. Black waste again some tempo and lose the center.
